articles.title: Auroras blasted a 250-mile-wide hole in Earth's ozone layer - Space.com
articles.description: Auroras set off spectacular light shows in the night sky, but they can also affect the ozone layer.
articles.content:
Auroras set off spectacular light shows in the night sky, but they are also illuminating another reason the ozone layer is being eaten away.
